subcommands.name: teku admin
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku admin [OPTIONS] [COMMAND]

Description:

Holds advanced tools for node admins

Options:

                  Path/filename of the yaml config file (default: none)
  -h, --help      Show this help message and exit.
  -V, --version   Print version information and exit.
Commands:
  weak-subjectivity  Commands related to weak subjectivity configuration

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0

subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku transition [OPTIONS] [COMMAND]

Description:

Manually run state transitions

Options:
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                  Path/filename of the yaml config file (default: none)
  -h, --help      Show this help message and exit.
  -V, --version   Print version information and exit.
Commands:
  blocks  Process blocks on the pre-state to get a post-state
  slots   Process empty slots on the pre-state to get a post-state

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0

subcommands.name: teku slashing-protection
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku slashing-protection [OPTIONS] [COMMAND]

Description:

Manage local slashing protection data used by the validator client.

Options:
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                  Path/filename of the yaml config file (default: none)
  -h, --help      Show this help message and exit.
  -V, --version   Print version information and exit.
Commands:
  import  Import slashing protection database. Supports minimal or complete
            interchange format.
  export  Export slashing protection database in minimal format.
  repair  Repair slashing protection data files used by teku.

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0

subcommands.name: teku migrate-database
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku migrate-database [OPTIONS]

Description:

Migrate the database to a specified version.

Options:
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                            Path/filename of the yaml config file (default:
                              none)
      --data-beacon-path=<FILENAME>
                            Path to beacon node data
                              Default: <data-base-path>/beacon
      --data-path, --data-base-path=<string>
                            The path to the teku database.
  -h, --help                Show this help message and exit.
  -n, --network=<NETWORK>   Represents which network to use. (default: mainnet)
  -V, --version             Print version information and exit.

subcommands.name: teku debug-tools
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku debug-tools [OPTIONS] [COMMAND]

Description:

Utilities for debugging issues

Options:
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                  Path/filename of the yaml config file (default: none)
  -h, --help      Show this help message and exit.
  -V, --version   Print version information and exit.
Commands:
  db                        Debugging tools for inspecting the contents of the
                              database
  pretty-print, pp          Print SSZ objects as formatted JSON
  key-check, kc             Check attributes of a validator key, and where it
                              is running from.
  rocksdb                   Print RocksDB information
  generate-autocomplete     Generate a bash/zsh autocomplete file
  generate-swagger-docs     Generate swagger-docs for rest APIs.
  get-peer-id               Gets the peerID from private key file.
  get-validator-assignment  Gets the committee assignment for a validator at a
                              specific epoch.

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0

options.description: Beacon Node REST API endpoint(s). If more than one endpoint is defined, the first node will be used as a primary and others as failovers.
Use SSZ encoding for API block requests
Path/filename of the yaml config file
Request confirmation before submitting voluntary exits.
Path to the base directory for storage
Path to validator client data
Earliest epoch that the voluntary exit can be processed. Defaults to current epoch.
Show this help message and exit.
Include validator keys managed via keymanager APIs.
Represents which network to use.
Save the generated exit messages to the specified path, don't validate exit epoch, and skip publishing them.
Print version information and exit.

<KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> will find <KEY_DIR>/**.json, and expect to find <PASS_DIR>/**.txt. <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE> will expect that the file <KEY_FILE> exists, and the file containing the password for it is <PASS_FILE>. The path separator is operating system dependent, and should be ';' in windows rather than ':'.
Optionally restrict the exit command to a specified list of public keys. When the parameter is not used, all keys will be exited.
Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to use for TLS mutual authentication with external signer
Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that will be used for TLS mutual authentication with external signer
The list of external signer public keys, or a URL to load the keys from
Timeout (in milliseconds) for the external signing service
Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to trust external signer's self-signed certificate
Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that will be used to trust external signer's self-signed certificate
URL for the external signing service

subcommands.name: teku voluntary-exit
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku voluntary-exit [OPTIONS]

Description:

Create and sign a voluntary exit for a specified validator.

Options:
      --beacon-node-api-endpoint, --beacon-node-api-endpoints=<ENDPOINT>[,
        <ENDPOINT>...]...
                            Beacon Node REST API endpoint(s). If more than one
                              endpoint is defined, the first node will be used
                              as a primary and others as failovers.
      --beacon-node-ssz-blocks-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Use SSZ encoding for API block requests
                              Default: true
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                            Path/filename of the yaml config file (default:
                              none)
      --confirmation-enabled=<BOOLEAN>
                            Request confirmation before submitting voluntary
                              exits.
                              Default: true
      --data-path, --data-base-path=<FILENAME>
                            Path to the base directory for storage
                              Default: /opt/teku/.local/share/teku
      --data-validator-path=<FILENAME>
                            Path to validator client data
                              Default: <data-base-path>/validator
      --epoch=<EPOCH>       Earliest epoch that the voluntary exit can be
                              processed. Defaults to current epoch.
  -h, --help                Show this help message and exit.
      --include-keymanager-keys[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Include validator keys managed via keymanager APIs.
                              Default: false
  -n, --network=<NETWORK>   Represents which network to use.
      --save-exits-path=<FOLDER>
                            Save the generated exit messages to the specified
                              path, don't validate exit epoch, and skip
                              publishing them.
  -V, --version             Print version information and exit.
      --validator-keys=<KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> | <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE>[,<KEY_DIR>:
        <PASS_DIR> | <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE>...]...
                            <KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> will find <KEY_DIR>/**.json,
                              and expect to find <PASS_DIR>/**.txt.
                            <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE> will expect that the file
                              <KEY_FILE> exists, and the file containing the
                              password for it is <PASS_FILE>.
                            The path separator is operating system dependent,
                              and should be ';' in windows rather than ':'.
                              Default: []
      --validator-public-keys[=<STRINGS>[,<STRINGS>...]]
                            Optionally restrict the exit command to a specified
                              list of public keys. When the parameter is not
                              used, all keys will be exited.
      --validators-external-signer-keystore=<FILE>
                            Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to use for TLS mutual
                              authentication with external signer
      --validators-external-signer-keystore-password-file=<FILE>
                            Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that
                              will be used for TLS mutual authentication with
                              external signer
      --validators-external-signer-public-keys[=<STRINGS>[,<STRINGS>...]...]
                            The list of external signer public keys, or a URL
                              to load the keys from
                              Default: []
      --validators-external-signer-timeout=<INTEGER>
                            Timeout (in milliseconds) for the external signing
                              service
                              Default: 5000
      --validators-external-signer-truststore=<FILE>
                            Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to trust external signer's
                              self-signed certificate
      --validators-external-signer-truststore-password-file=<FILE>
                            Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that
                              will be used to trust external signer's
                              self-signed certificate
      --validators-external-signer-url=<NETWORK>
                            URL for the external signing service

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0
subcommands.description: Create and sign a voluntary exit for a specified validator.

options.description: Beacon Node REST API endpoint(s). If more than one endpoint is defined, the first node will be used as a primary and others as failovers.
Use SSZ encoding for API block requests
Path/filename of the yaml config file
Path to the base directory for storage
Path to validator client data
Enable validators doppelganger detection
Enable terminating the process if no validator keys are found during startup
Show this help message and exit.
Logging verbosity levels: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL.
Whether Status and Event log messages include a console color display code
Whether a logger is added for the console, the log file, or both (Valid values: BOTH, CONSOLE, DEFAULT_BOTH, FILE, CUSTOM)
Path containing the location (relative or absolute) and the log filename. If not set will default to <data-path>/logs/teku.log
Pattern for the filename to apply to rolled over log files. If not set will default to <data-path>/logs/teku_%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log
Whether frequent update events are logged (e.g. every slot and epoch event)
Whether events are logged when validators perform duties
Whether block production timing metrics are tracked and reported
Whether block timing metrics are tracked and reported
Metric categories to enable
options.default: [JVM, PROCESS, BEACON, NETWORK, DISCOVERY, VALIDATOR_DUTY, EVENTBUS, EXECUTOR, LIBP2P, VALIDATOR_PERFORMANCE, STORAGE, VALIDATOR, STORAGE_HOT_DB, STORAGE_FINALIZED_DB]

options.description: Enables metrics collection via Prometheus
Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or * to allow any host
Metrics network interface to expose metrics for Prometheus
Metrics port to expose metrics for Prometheus
Publish metrics for node monitoring to an external service
Interval between metric publications to the external service (measured in seconds)
Represents which network to use. Use `auto` to fetch network configuration from the beacon node endpoint directly.
If enabled and an owned validator key is detected as slashed, the node will terminate. In this case, the service should not be restarted.
Print version information and exit.
Use the specified file as the bearer token for the validator Rest API
Comma separated list of origins to allow, or * to allow any origin
Enable swagger-docs and swagger-ui endpoints
Enables Validator Rest API
Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or * to allow any host
Interface of Validator Rest API
Keystore used for ssl for the validator api.
Password used to decrypt the keystore for the validator api.
Port number of Rest API
Restrict local signing to a single operation at a time.

<KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> will find <KEY_DIR>/**.json, and expect to find <PASS_DIR>/**.txt. <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE> will expect that the file <KEY_FILE> exists, and the file containing the password for it is <PASS_FILE>. The path separator is operating system dependent, and should be ';' in windows rather than ':'.
Enable validators registration to builder infrastructure.
Change the default gas limit used for the validators registration.
Generate attestations as soon as a block is known, rather than delaying until the attestation is due
Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to use for TLS mutual authentication with external signer
Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that will be used for TLS mutual authentication with external signer
The list of external signer public keys, or a URL to load the keys from
Enable internal slashing protection for external signers
Timeout (in milliseconds) for the external signing service
Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to trust external signer's self-signed certificate
Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that will be used to trust external signer's self-signed certificate
URL for the external signing service
Graffiti value to include during block creation. Value gets converted to bytes and padded to Bytes32.
Appends CL and EL clients information with a space to user's graffiti when producing a block on the Beacon Node. (Valid values: AUTO, CLIENT_CODES, DISABLED)

File to load graffiti value to include during block creation. Value gets converted to bytes and padded to Bytes32. Takes precedence over --validators-graffiti. If the file can not be read, the --validators-graffiti value is used as a fallback.
Enable locking validator keystore files
Set strategy for handling performance tracking. Valid values: LOGGING, METRICS, ALL, NONE
remote URL or local file path to load proposer configuration from
Enable the proposer configuration reload on every proposer preparation (once per epoch)
Default fee recipient sent to the execution engine, which could use it as fee recipient when producing a new execution block.

subcommands.name: teku validator-client
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku validator-client [OPTIONS]

Description:

Run a Validator Client that connects to a remote Beacon Node

Options:
      --beacon-node-api-endpoint, --beacon-node-api-endpoints=<ENDPOINT>[,
        <ENDPOINT>...]...
                            Beacon Node REST API endpoint(s). If more than one
                              endpoint is defined, the first node will be used
                              as a primary and others as failovers.
      --beacon-node-ssz-blocks-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Use SSZ encoding for API block requests
                              Default: true
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                            Path/filename of the yaml config file (default:
                              none)
      --data-path, --data-base-path=<FILENAME>
                            Path to the base directory for storage
                              Default: /opt/teku/.local/share/teku
      --data-validator-path=<FILENAME>
                            Path to validator client data
                              Default: <data-base-path>/validator
      --doppelganger-detection-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable validators doppelganger detection
                              Default: false
      --exit-when-no-validator-keys-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable terminating the process if no validator keys
                              are found during startup
                              Default: false
  -h, --help                Show this help message and exit.
  -l, --logging=<LOG VERBOSITY LEVEL>
                            Logging verbosity levels: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN,
                              INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL (default: INFO).
      --log-color-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Whether Status and Event log messages include a
                              console color display code
                              Default: true
      --log-destination=<LOG_DESTINATION>
                            Whether a logger is added for the console, the log
                              file, or both (Valid values: BOTH, CONSOLE,
                              DEFAULT_BOTH, FILE, CUSTOM)
                              Default: DEFAULT_BOTH
      --log-file=<FILENAME> Path containing the location (relative or absolute)
                              and the log filename. If not set will default to
                              <data-path>/logs/teku.log
      --log-file-name-pattern=<REGEX>
                            Pattern for the filename to apply to rolled over
                              log files. If not set will default to
                              <data-path>/logs/teku_%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log
      --log-include-events-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Whether frequent update events are logged (e.g.
                              every slot and epoch event)
                              Default: true
      --log-include-validator-duties-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Whether events are logged when validators perform
                              duties
                              Default: true
      --metrics-block-production-performance-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Whether block production timing metrics are tracked
                              and reported
                              Default: false
      --metrics-block-timing-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Whether block timing metrics are tracked and
                              reported
                              Default: true
      --metrics-categories[=<METRICS_CATEGORY>[,<METRICS_CATEGORY>...]...]
                            Metric categories to enable
                              Default: [JVM, PROCESS, BEACON, NETWORK,
                              DISCOVERY, VALIDATOR_DUTY, EVENTBUS, EXECUTOR,
                              LIBP2P, VALIDATOR_PERFORMANCE, STORAGE,
                              VALIDATOR, STORAGE_HOT_DB, STORAGE_FINALIZED_DB]
      --metrics-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enables metrics collection via Prometheus
                              Default: false
      --metrics-host-allowlist[=<hostname>[,<hostname>...]...]
                            Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or * to
                              allow any host
                              Default: [127.0.0.1, localhost]
      --metrics-interface=<NETWORK>
                            Metrics network interface to expose metrics for
                              Prometheus
                              Default: 127.0.0.1
      --metrics-port=<INTEGER>
                            Metrics port to expose metrics for Prometheus
                              Default: 8008
      --metrics-publish-endpoint=<URL>
                            Publish metrics for node monitoring to an external
                              service
      --metrics-publish-interval=<INTEGER>
                            Interval between metric publications to the
                              external service (measured in seconds)
                              Default: 60
  -n, --network=<NETWORK>   Represents which network to use. Use `auto` to
                              fetch network configuration from the beacon node
                              endpoint directly.
                              Default: auto
      --shut-down-when-validator-slashed-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            If enabled and an owned validator key is detected
                              as slashed, the node will terminate. In this
                              case, the service should not be restarted.
                              Default: false
  -V, --version             Print version information and exit.
      --validator-api-bearer-file=<FILENAME>
                            Use the specified file as the bearer token for the
                              validator Rest API
      --validator-api-cors-origins[=<origin>[,<origin>...]...]
                            Comma separated list of origins to allow, or * to
                              allow any origin
                              Default: []
      --validator-api-docs-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable swagger-docs and swagger-ui endpoints
                              Default: false
      --validator-api-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enables Validator Rest API
                              Default: false
      --validator-api-host-allowlist[=<hostname>[,<hostname>...]...]
                            Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or * to
                              allow any host
                              Default: [127.0.0.1, localhost]
      --validator-api-interface=<NETWORK>
                            Interface of Validator Rest API
                              Default: 127.0.0.1
      --validator-api-keystore-file=<keystoreFile>
                            Keystore used for ssl for the validator api.
      --validator-api-keystore-password-file=<keystorePasswordFile>
                            Password used to decrypt the keystore for the
                              validator api.
      --validator-api-port=<INTEGER>
                            Port number of Rest API
                              Default: 5052
      --validator-is-local-slashing-protection-synchronized-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Restrict local signing to a single operation at a
                              time.
                              Default: true
      --validator-keys=<KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> | <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE>[,<KEY_DIR>:
        <PASS_DIR> | <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE>...]...
                            <KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> will find <KEY_DIR>/**.json,
                              and expect to find <PASS_DIR>/**.txt.
                            <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE> will expect that the file
                              <KEY_FILE> exists, and the file containing the
                              password for it is <PASS_FILE>.
                            The path separator is operating system dependent,
                              and should be ';' in windows rather than ':'.
                              Default: []
      --validators-builder-registration-default-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable validators registration to builder
                              infrastructure.
                              Default: false
      --validators-builder-registration-default-gas-limit=<uint64>
                            Change the default gas limit used for the
                              validators registration.
                              Default: 60000000
      --validators-early-attestations-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Generate attestations as soon as a block is known,
                              rather than delaying until the attestation is due
                              Default: true
      --validators-external-signer-keystore=<FILE>
                            Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to use for TLS mutual
                              authentication with external signer
      --validators-external-signer-keystore-password-file=<FILE>
                            Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that
                              will be used for TLS mutual authentication with
                              external signer
      --validators-external-signer-public-keys[=<STRINGS>[,<STRINGS>...]...]
                            The list of external signer public keys, or a URL
                              to load the keys from
                              Default: []
      --validators-external-signer-slashing-protection-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable internal slashing protection for external
                              signers
                              Default: true
      --validators-external-signer-timeout=<INTEGER>
                            Timeout (in milliseconds) for the external signing
                              service
                              Default: 5000
      --validators-external-signer-truststore=<FILE>
                            Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to trust external signer's
                              self-signed certificate
      --validators-external-signer-truststore-password-file=<FILE>
                            Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS) that
                              will be used to trust external signer's
                              self-signed certificate
      --validators-external-signer-url=<NETWORK>
                            URL for the external signing service
      --validators-graffiti=<GRAFFITI STRING>
                            Graffiti value to include during block creation.
                              Value gets converted to bytes and padded to
                              Bytes32.
      --validators-graffiti-client-append-format=<STRING>
                            Appends CL and EL clients information with a space
                              to user's graffiti when producing a block on the
                              Beacon Node. (Valid values: AUTO, CLIENT_CODES,
                              DISABLED)
                              Default: AUTO
      --validators-graffiti-file=<GRAFFITI FILE>
                            File to load graffiti value to include during block
                              creation. Value gets converted to bytes and
                              padded to Bytes32. Takes precedence over
                              --validators-graffiti. If the file can not be
                              read, the --validators-graffiti value is used as
                              a fallback.
      --validators-keystore-locking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable locking validator keystore files
                              Default: true
      --validators-performance-tracking-mode=<TRACKING_MODE>
                            Set strategy for handling performance tracking.
                              Valid values: LOGGING, METRICS, ALL, NONE
                              Default: ALL
      --validators-proposer-config=<STRING>
                            remote URL or local file path to load proposer
                              configuration from
      --validators-proposer-config-refresh-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                            Enable the proposer configuration reload on every
                              proposer preparation (once per epoch)
                              Default: false
      --validators-proposer-default-fee-recipient=<ADDRESS>
                            Default fee recipient sent to the execution engine,
                              which could use it as fee recipient when
                              producing a new execution block.

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0
subcommands.description: Run a Validator Client that connects to a remote Beacon Node

options.description: Path/filename of the yaml config file
The Checkpointz server that will be used to bootstrap this node.
Path to beacon node data
Path to the base directory for storage
Sets the frequency, in slots, at which to store finalized states to disk. This option is ignored if --data-storage-mode is set to PRUNE
Sets the strategy for handling historical chain data.  (Valid values: ARCHIVE, PRUNE, MINIMAL, NOT_SET)
Store non-canonical blocks and associated blobs if they exist
Path to validator client data
Contract address for the deposit contract. Only required when creating a custom network.
Force deletion of the beacon chain database on startup. This will delete all chain data but preserve validator slashing protection. Use with caution - all historical chain data will be lost.
The genesis state. This value should be a file or URL pointing to an SSZ-encoded finalized checkpoint state.
Show this help message and exit.
Allows syncing outside of the weak subjectivity period.
The initial state. This value should be a file or URL pointing to an SSZ-encoded finalized checkpoint state.
Logging verbosity levels: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN, INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL
Whether Status and Event log messages include a console color display code
Whether a logger is added for the console, the log file, or both (Valid values: BOTH, CONSOLE, DEFAULT_BOTH, FILE, CUSTOM)
Path containing the location (relative or absolute) and the log filename. If not set will default to <data-path>/logs/teku.log
Pattern for the filename to apply to rolled over log files. If not set will default to <data-path>/logs/teku_%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log
Whether frequent update events are logged (e.g. every slot and epoch event)
Whether events are logged when validators perform duties
Whether block production timing metrics are tracked and reported
Whether block timing metrics are tracked and reported
Metric categories to enable
options.default: [JVM, PROCESS, VALIDATOR_DUTY, EVENTBUS, EXECUTOR, LIBP2P, VALIDATOR_PERFORMANCE, STORAGE, VALIDATOR, STORAGE_HOT_DB, STORAGE_FINALIZED_DB, BEACON, NETWORK, DISCOVERY]

options.description: Enables metrics collection via Prometheus
Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or * to allow any host
Metrics network interface to expose metrics for Prometheus
Metrics port to expose metrics for Prometheus
Publish metrics for node monitoring to an external service
Interval between metric publications to the external service (measured in seconds)
Represents which network to use.
P2P advertised IP address(es). You can define up to 2 addresses, with one being IPv4 and the other IPv6.
P2P advertised port. The default is the port specified in --p2p-port
P2P advertised IPv6 port. This port is only used when advertising both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
Advertised UDP port to external peers. The default is the port specified in --p2p-advertised-port
Advertised IPv6 UDP port to external peers. This port is only used when advertising both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
Specifies a list of 'direct' peers with which to establish and maintain connections.
List of ENRs of the bootnodes
ENRs of bootnodes. This should be a file or URL pointing to a txt file with one ENR per line.
Enables discv5 discovery
Whether discovery accepts messages and peer records with site local (RFC1918) addresses
Enables P2P
The network interface(s) on which the node listens for P2P communication.
Specify the NAT circumvention method to be used, possible values are UPNP, NONE. NONE will require manual router configuration.
Lower bound on the target number of peers
Upper bound on the target number of peers
P2P port
P2P IPv6 port. This port is only used when listening over both IPv4 and IPv6.
This node's private key file in LibP2P format. If not specified, uses or generates a key which is stored within the <beacon-data-dir>.
Specifies a comma-separated list of 'static' peers with which to establish and maintain connections. Accepts multiaddr format.
Specifies a URL or file containing a list of 'static' peers (one per line) with which to establish and maintain connections. Accepts multiaddr format.
UDP port used for discovery. The default is the port specified in --p2p-port
IPv6 UDP port used for discovery. This port is only used when listening over both IPv4 and IPv6. The default is the port specified in --p2p-port-ipv6
Print version information and exit.

subcommands.name: teku bootnode
subcommands.raw_help_text:
teku bootnode [OPTIONS]

Description:

Run Teku in Bootnode mode

Options:
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                             Path/filename of the yaml config file (default:
                               none)
      --checkpoint-sync-url=<STRING>
                             The Checkpointz server that will be used to
                               bootstrap this node.
      --data-beacon-path=<FILENAME>
                             Path to beacon node data
                               Default: <data-base-path>/beacon
      --data-path, --data-base-path=<FILENAME>
                             Path to the base directory for storage
                               Default: /opt/teku/.local/share/teku
      --data-storage-archive-frequency=<FREQUENCY>
                             Sets the frequency, in slots, at which to store
                               finalized states to disk. This option is ignored
                               if --data-storage-mode is set to PRUNE
                               Default: 2048
      --data-storage-mode=<STORAGE_MODE>
                             Sets the strategy for handling historical chain
                               data.  (Valid values: ARCHIVE, PRUNE, MINIMAL,
                               NOT_SET)
                               Default: NOT_SET
      --data-storage-non-canonical-blocks-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Store non-canonical blocks and associated blobs if
                               they exist
                               Default: false
      --data-validator-path=<FILENAME>
                             Path to validator client data
                               Default: <data-base-path>/validator
      --eth1-deposit-contract-address=<ADDRESS>
                             Contract address for the deposit contract. Only
                               required when creating a custom network.
      --force-clear-db[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Force deletion of the beacon chain database on
                               startup. This will delete all chain data but
                               preserve validator slashing protection. Use with
                               caution - all historical chain data will be lost.
                               Default: false
      --genesis-state=<STRING>
                             The genesis state. This value should be a file or
                               URL pointing to an SSZ-encoded finalized
                               checkpoint state.
  -h, --help                 Show this help message and exit.
      --ignore-weak-subjectivity-period-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Allows syncing outside of the weak subjectivity
                               period.
                               Default: false
      --initial-state=<STRING>
                             The initial state. This value should be a file or
                               URL pointing to an SSZ-encoded finalized
                               checkpoint state.
  -l, --logging=<LOG VERBOSITY LEVEL>
                             Logging verbosity levels: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN,
                               INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL (default: INFO).
      --log-color-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether Status and Event log messages include a
                               console color display code
                               Default: true
      --log-destination=<LOG_DESTINATION>
                             Whether a logger is added for the console, the log
                               file, or both (Valid values: BOTH, CONSOLE,
                               DEFAULT_BOTH, FILE, CUSTOM)
                               Default: DEFAULT_BOTH
      --log-file=<FILENAME>  Path containing the location (relative or
                               absolute) and the log filename. If not set will
                               default to <data-path>/logs/teku.log
      --log-file-name-pattern=<REGEX>
                             Pattern for the filename to apply to rolled over
                               log files. If not set will default to
                               <data-path>/logs/teku_%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log
      --log-include-events-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether frequent update events are logged (e.g.
                               every slot and epoch event)
                               Default: true
      --log-include-validator-duties-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether events are logged when validators perform
                               duties
                               Default: true
      --metrics-block-production-performance-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether block production timing metrics are
                               tracked and reported
                               Default: false
      --metrics-block-timing-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether block timing metrics are tracked and
                               reported
                               Default: true
      --metrics-categories[=<METRICS_CATEGORY>[,<METRICS_CATEGORY>...]...]
                             Metric categories to enable
                               Default: [JVM, PROCESS, VALIDATOR_DUTY,
                               EVENTBUS, EXECUTOR, LIBP2P,
                               VALIDATOR_PERFORMANCE, STORAGE, VALIDATOR,
                               STORAGE_HOT_DB, STORAGE_FINALIZED_DB, BEACON,
                               NETWORK, DISCOVERY]
      --metrics-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables metrics collection via Prometheus
                               Default: false
      --metrics-host-allowlist[=<hostname>[,<hostname>...]...]
                             Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or *
                               to allow any host
                               Default: [127.0.0.1, localhost]
      --metrics-interface=<NETWORK>
                             Metrics network interface to expose metrics for
                               Prometheus
                               Default: 127.0.0.1
      --metrics-port=<INTEGER>
                             Metrics port to expose metrics for Prometheus
                               Default: 8008
      --metrics-publish-endpoint=<URL>
                             Publish metrics for node monitoring to an external
                               service
      --metrics-publish-interval=<INTEGER>
                             Interval between metric publications to the
                               external service (measured in seconds)
                               Default: 60
  -n, --network=<NETWORK>    Represents which network to use.
                               Default: mainnet
      --p2p-advertised-ip, --p2p-advertised-ips=<NETWORK>[,<NETWORK>...]
        [<NETWORK>]
                             P2P advertised IP address(es). You can define up
                               to 2 addresses, with one being IPv4 and the
                               other IPv6. (Default: 127.0.0.1)
      --p2p-advertised-port=<INTEGER>
                             P2P advertised port. The default is the port
                               specified in --p2p-port
      --p2p-advertised-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             P2P advertised IPv6 port. This port is only used
                               when advertising both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
                             The default is the port specified in
                               --p2p-port-ipv6.
      --p2p-advertised-udp-port=<INTEGER>
                             Advertised UDP port to external peers. The default
                               is the port specified in --p2p-advertised-port
      --p2p-advertised-udp-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             Advertised IPv6 UDP port to external peers. This
                               port is only used when advertising both IPv4 and
                               IPv6 addresses.
                             The default is the port specified in
                               --p2p-advertised-port-ipv6.
      --p2p-direct-peers[=<PEER_ADDRESSES>[,<PEER_ADDRESSES>...]...]
                             Specifies a list of 'direct' peers with which to
                               establish and maintain connections.
                             Direct peers are static peers with which this node
                               will always exchange full messages, regardless
                               of peer scoring mechanisms.
                             Such peers will also need to enable you as direct
                               in order to work.
                               Default: []
      --p2p-discovery-bootnodes[=<enr:-...>[,<enr:-...>...]...]
                             List of ENRs of the bootnodes
      --p2p-discovery-bootnodes-url=<STRING>
                             ENRs of bootnodes. This should be a file or URL
                               pointing to a txt file with one ENR per line.
      --p2p-discovery-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables discv5 discovery
                               Default: true
      --p2p-discovery-site-local-addresses-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether discovery accepts messages and peer
                               records with site local (RFC1918) addresses
                               Default: false
      --p2p-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables P2P
                               Default: true
      --p2p-interface, --p2p-interfaces=<NETWORK>[,<NETWORK>...] [<NETWORK>]
                             The network interface(s) on which the node listens
                               for P2P communication.
                             You can define up to 2 interfaces, with one being
                               IPv4 and the other IPv6. (Default: 0.0.0.0)
                               Default: [0.0.0.0]
      --p2p-nat-method=<natMethod>
                             Specify the NAT circumvention method to be used,
                               possible values are UPNP, NONE. NONE will
                               require manual router configuration.
                               Default: NONE
      --p2p-peer-lower-bound=<INTEGER>
                             Lower bound on the target number of peers
                               Default: OptionalInt.empty
      --p2p-peer-upper-bound=<INTEGER>
                             Upper bound on the target number of peers
                               Default: OptionalInt.empty
      --p2p-port=<INTEGER>   P2P port
                               Default: 9000
      --p2p-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             P2P IPv6 port. This port is only used when
                               listening over both IPv4 and IPv6.
                               Default: 9090
      --p2p-private-key-file=<FILENAME>
                             This node's private key file in LibP2P format. If
                               not specified, uses or generates a key which is
                               stored within the <beacon-data-dir>.
      --p2p-static-peers=<PEER_ADDRESSES>[,<PEER_ADDRESSES>...]
                             Specifies a comma-separated list of 'static' peers
                               with which to establish and maintain
                               connections. Accepts multiaddr format.
                               Default: []
      --p2p-static-peers-url=<URL>
                             Specifies a URL or file containing a list of
                               'static' peers (one per line) with which to
                               establish and maintain connections. Accepts
                               multiaddr format.
      --p2p-subscribe-all-custody-subnets-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                               Default: false
      --p2p-subscribe-all-subnets-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                               Default: false
      --p2p-udp-port=<INTEGER>
                             UDP port used for discovery. The default is the
                               port specified in --p2p-port
      --p2p-udp-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             IPv6 UDP port used for discovery. This port is
                               only used when listening over both IPv4 and
                               IPv6. The default is the port specified in
                               --p2p-port-ipv6
      --reconstruct-historic-states[=<BOOLEAN>]
                               Default: false
  -V, --version              Print version information and exit.

Teku is licensed under the Apache License 2.0

name: teku
raw_help_text:
teku [OPTIONS] [COMMAND]

Description:

Run the Teku beacon chain client and validator

Options:
  -c, --config-file=<FILENAME>
                             Path/filename of the yaml config file (default:
                               none)
  -h, --help                 Show this help message and exit.
  -V, --version              Print version information and exit.

Network
      --checkpoint-sync-url=<STRING>
                             The Checkpointz server that will be used to
                               bootstrap this node.
      --eth1-deposit-contract-address=<ADDRESS>
                             Contract address for the deposit contract. Only
                               required when creating a custom network.
      --genesis-state=<STRING>
                             The genesis state. This value should be a file or
                               URL pointing to an SSZ-encoded finalized
                               checkpoint state.
      --ignore-weak-subjectivity-period-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Allows syncing outside of the weak subjectivity
                               period.
                               Default: false
      --initial-state=<STRING>
                             The initial state. This value should be a file or
                               URL pointing to an SSZ-encoded finalized
                               checkpoint state.
  -n, --network=<NETWORK>    Represents which network to use.
                               Default: mainnet

P2P
      --p2p-advertised-ip, --p2p-advertised-ips=<NETWORK>[,<NETWORK>...]
        [<NETWORK>]
                             P2P advertised IP address(es). You can define up
                               to 2 addresses, with one being IPv4 and the
                               other IPv6. (Default: 127.0.0.1)
      --p2p-advertised-port=<INTEGER>
                             P2P advertised port. The default is the port
                               specified in --p2p-port
      --p2p-advertised-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             P2P advertised IPv6 port. This port is only used
                               when advertising both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
                             The default is the port specified in
                               --p2p-port-ipv6.
      --p2p-advertised-udp-port=<INTEGER>
                             Advertised UDP port to external peers. The default
                               is the port specified in --p2p-advertised-port
      --p2p-advertised-udp-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             Advertised IPv6 UDP port to external peers. This
                               port is only used when advertising both IPv4 and
                               IPv6 addresses.
                             The default is the port specified in
                               --p2p-advertised-port-ipv6.
      --p2p-direct-peers[=<PEER_ADDRESSES>[,<PEER_ADDRESSES>...]...]
                             Specifies a list of 'direct' peers with which to
                               establish and maintain connections.
                             Direct peers are static peers with which this node
                               will always exchange full messages, regardless
                               of peer scoring mechanisms.
                             Such peers will also need to enable you as direct
                               in order to work.
                               Default: []
      --p2p-discovery-bootnodes[=<enr:-...>[,<enr:-...>...]...]
                             List of ENRs of the bootnodes
      --p2p-discovery-bootnodes-url=<STRING>
                             ENRs of bootnodes. This should be a file or URL
                               pointing to a txt file with one ENR per line.
      --p2p-discovery-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables discv5 discovery
                               Default: true
      --p2p-discovery-site-local-addresses-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether discovery accepts messages and peer
                               records with site local (RFC1918) addresses
                               Default: false
      --p2p-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables P2P
                               Default: true
      --p2p-interface, --p2p-interfaces=<NETWORK>[,<NETWORK>...] [<NETWORK>]
                             The network interface(s) on which the node listens
                               for P2P communication.
                             You can define up to 2 interfaces, with one being
                               IPv4 and the other IPv6. (Default: 0.0.0.0)
                               Default: [0.0.0.0]
      --p2p-nat-method=<natMethod>
                             Specify the NAT circumvention method to be used,
                               possible values are UPNP, NONE. NONE will
                               require manual router configuration.
                               Default: NONE
      --p2p-peer-lower-bound=<INTEGER>
                             Lower bound on the target number of peers
                               Default: OptionalInt.empty
      --p2p-peer-upper-bound=<INTEGER>
                             Upper bound on the target number of peers
                               Default: OptionalInt.empty
      --p2p-port=<INTEGER>   P2P port
                               Default: 9000
      --p2p-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             P2P IPv6 port. This port is only used when
                               listening over both IPv4 and IPv6.
                               Default: 9090
      --p2p-private-key-file=<FILENAME>
                             This node's private key file in LibP2P format. If
                               not specified, uses or generates a key which is
                               stored within the <beacon-data-dir>.
      --p2p-static-peers=<PEER_ADDRESSES>[,<PEER_ADDRESSES>...]
                             Specifies a comma-separated list of 'static' peers
                               with which to establish and maintain
                               connections. Accepts multiaddr format.
                               Default: []
      --p2p-static-peers-url=<URL>
                             Specifies a URL or file containing a list of
                               'static' peers (one per line) with which to
                               establish and maintain connections. Accepts
                               multiaddr format.
      --p2p-subscribe-all-custody-subnets-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                               Default: false
      --p2p-subscribe-all-subnets-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                               Default: false
      --p2p-udp-port=<INTEGER>
                             UDP port used for discovery. The default is the
                               port specified in --p2p-port
      --p2p-udp-port-ipv6=<INTEGER>
                             IPv6 UDP port used for discovery. This port is
                               only used when listening over both IPv4 and
                               IPv6. The default is the port specified in
                               --p2p-port-ipv6

Validator
      --doppelganger-detection-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable validators doppelganger detection
                               Default: false
      --exit-when-no-validator-keys-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable terminating the process if no validator
                               keys are found during startup
                               Default: false
      --shut-down-when-validator-slashed-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             If enabled and an owned validator key is detected
                               as slashed, the node will terminate. In this
                               case, the service should not be restarted.
                               Default: false
      --validator-is-local-slashing-protection-synchronized-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Restrict local signing to a single operation at a
                               time.
                               Default: true
      --validator-keys=<KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> | <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE>[,<KEY_DIR>:
        <PASS_DIR> | <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE>...]...
                             <KEY_DIR>:<PASS_DIR> will find <KEY_DIR>/**.json,
                               and expect to find <PASS_DIR>/**.txt.
                             <KEY_FILE>:<PASS_FILE> will expect that the file
                               <KEY_FILE> exists, and the file containing the
                               password for it is <PASS_FILE>.
                             The path separator is operating system dependent,
                               and should be ';' in windows rather than ':'.
                               Default: []
      --validators-builder-registration-default-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable validators registration to builder
                               infrastructure.
                               Default: false
      --validators-builder-registration-default-gas-limit=<uint64>
                             Change the default gas limit used for the
                               validators registration.
                               Default: 60000000
      --validators-early-attestations-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Generate attestations as soon as a block is known,
                               rather than delaying until the attestation is due
                               Default: true
      --validators-external-signer-keystore=<FILE>
                             Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to use for TLS mutual
                               authentication with external signer
      --validators-external-signer-keystore-password-file=<FILE>
                             Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS)
                               that will be used for TLS mutual authentication
                               with external signer
      --validators-external-signer-public-keys[=<STRINGS>[,<STRINGS>...]...]
                             The list of external signer public keys, or a URL
                               to load the keys from
                               Default: []
      --validators-external-signer-slashing-protection-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable internal slashing protection for external
                               signers
                               Default: true
      --validators-external-signer-timeout=<INTEGER>
                             Timeout (in milliseconds) for the external signing
                               service
                               Default: 5000
      --validators-external-signer-truststore=<FILE>
                             Keystore (PKCS12/JKS) to trust external signer's
                               self-signed certificate
      --validators-external-signer-truststore-password-file=<FILE>
                             Password file to decrypt keystore (PKCS12/JKS)
                               that will be used to trust external signer's
                               self-signed certificate
      --validators-external-signer-url=<NETWORK>
                             URL for the external signing service
      --validators-graffiti=<GRAFFITI STRING>
                             Graffiti value to include during block creation.
                               Value gets converted to bytes and padded to
                               Bytes32.
      --validators-graffiti-client-append-format=<STRING>
                             Appends CL and EL clients information with a space
                               to user's graffiti when producing a block on the
                               Beacon Node. (Valid values: AUTO, CLIENT_CODES,
                               DISABLED)
                               Default: AUTO
      --validators-graffiti-file=<GRAFFITI FILE>
                             File to load graffiti value to include during
                               block creation. Value gets converted to bytes
                               and padded to Bytes32. Takes precedence over
                               --validators-graffiti. If the file can not be
                               read, the --validators-graffiti value is used as
                               a fallback.
      --validators-keystore-locking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable locking validator keystore files
                               Default: true
      --validators-performance-tracking-mode=<TRACKING_MODE>
                             Set strategy for handling performance tracking.
                               Valid values: LOGGING, METRICS, ALL, NONE
                               Default: ALL
      --validators-proposer-config=<STRING>
                             remote URL or local file path to load proposer
                               configuration from
      --validators-proposer-config-refresh-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable the proposer configuration reload on every
                               proposer preparation (once per epoch)
                               Default: false
      --validators-proposer-default-fee-recipient=<ADDRESS>
                             Default fee recipient sent to the execution
                               engine, which could use it as fee recipient when
                               producing a new execution block.

Execution Layer
      --builder-bid-compare-factor=<STRING>
                             Set the compare factor applied to the builder bid
                               value when comparing it with locally produced
                               payload. Factor is expressed in percentage (e.g.
                               '100' means locally produced payload will be
                               chosen when its value is equal or greater than
                               the entire builder bid value, '80' means local
                               payload will be chosen when its value is at
                               least 80% of builder bid value).
                             Set it to 'BUILDER_ALWAYS' to always use builder
                               bid. In this configuration locally produced
                               payload will be used only when the bid is
                               invalid.
                               Default: 90
      --builder-endpoint=<NETWORK>
                             URL for an external Builder node (optional).
                               Default: null
      --builder-set-user-agent-header[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Set User-Agent header to teku/v<version> (e.g.
                               teku/v23.4.0) when making a builder bid request
                               to help builders identify clients and versions
                               Default: true
      --deposit-snapshot-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Use bundled snapshot for most networks and persist
                               deposit tree snapshot
                               Default: true
      --ee-endpoint=<NETWORK>
                             URL for Execution Engine node.
      --ee-jwt-claim-id=<STRING>
                             A unique identifier for the consensus layer
                               client. This identifier will be added to the JWT
                               claims as an 'id' claim.
      --ee-jwt-secret-file=<FILENAME>
                             Location of the file specifying the hex-encoded
                               256 bit secret key to be used for
                               verifying/generating jwt tokens
      --eth1-deposit-contract-max-request-size=<INTEGER>
                             Maximum number of blocks to request deposit
                               contract event logs for in a single request.
                               Default: 10000
      --eth1-endpoint, --eth1-endpoints=<NETWORK>[,<NETWORK>...]...
                             URLs for Eth1 nodes.
                               Default: []
      --exchange-capabilities-monitoring-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables querying EL periodically for the Engine
                               API methods it supports. If incompatibility is
                               detected, there will be a warning raised in the
                               logs.
                               Default: true

Data Storage
      --data-beacon-path=<FILENAME>
                             Path to beacon node data
                               Default: <data-base-path>/beacon
      --data-path, --data-base-path=<FILENAME>
                             Path to the base directory for storage
                               Default: /opt/teku/.local/share/teku
      --data-storage-archive-frequency=<FREQUENCY>
                             Sets the frequency, in slots, at which to store
                               finalized states to disk. This option is ignored
                               if --data-storage-mode is set to PRUNE
                               Default: 2048
      --data-storage-mode=<STORAGE_MODE>
                             Sets the strategy for handling historical chain
                               data.  (Valid values: ARCHIVE, PRUNE, MINIMAL,
                               NOT_SET)
                               Default: NOT_SET
      --data-storage-non-canonical-blocks-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Store non-canonical blocks and associated blobs if
                               they exist
                               Default: false
      --data-validator-path=<FILENAME>
                             Path to validator client data
                               Default: <data-base-path>/validator
      --force-clear-db[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Force deletion of the beacon chain database on
                               startup. This will delete all chain data but
                               preserve validator slashing protection. Use with
                               caution - all historical chain data will be lost.
                               Default: false
      --reconstruct-historic-states[=<BOOLEAN>]
                               Default: false

Beacon REST API
      --beacon-liveness-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Track validator liveness and enable requests to
                               the liveness rest api.
                               Default: false
      --rest-api-cors-origins[=<origin>[,<origin>...]...]
                             Comma separated list of origins to allow, or * to
                               allow any origin
                               Default: []
      --rest-api-docs-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable swagger-docs and swagger-ui endpoints
                               Default: false
      --rest-api-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables Beacon Rest API
                               Default: null
      --rest-api-getblobs-sidecars-download-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables Get Blobs API ability to reconstruct blobs
                               via on-demand p2p columns downloading
                               Default: false
      --rest-api-getblobs-sidecars-download-timeout=<INTEGER>
                             Sidecars download timeout in seconds
                               Default: 5
      --rest-api-host-allowlist[=<hostname>[,<hostname>...]...]
                             Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or *
                               to allow any host
                               Default: [127.0.0.1, localhost]
      --rest-api-interface=<NETWORK>
                             Interface of Beacon Rest API
                               Default: 127.0.0.1
      --rest-api-port=<INTEGER>
                             Port number of Beacon Rest API

Validator REST API
      --validator-api-bearer-file=<FILENAME>
                             Use the specified file as the bearer token for the
                               validator Rest API
      --validator-api-cors-origins[=<origin>[,<origin>...]...]
                             Comma separated list of origins to allow, or * to
                               allow any origin
                               Default: []
      --validator-api-docs-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enable swagger-docs and swagger-ui endpoints
                               Default: false
      --validator-api-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables Validator Rest API
                               Default: false
      --validator-api-host-allowlist[=<hostname>[,<hostname>...]...]
                             Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or *
                               to allow any host
                               Default: [127.0.0.1, localhost]
      --validator-api-interface=<NETWORK>
                             Interface of Validator Rest API
                               Default: 127.0.0.1
      --validator-api-keystore-file=<keystoreFile>
                             Keystore used for ssl for the validator api.
      --validator-api-keystore-password-file=<keystorePasswordFile>
                             Password used to decrypt the keystore for the
                               validator api.
      --validator-api-port=<INTEGER>
                             Port number of Rest API
                               Default: 5052

Weak Subjectivity
      --ws-checkpoint=<STRING>
                             A recent checkpoint within the weak subjectivity
                               period. Should be a string containing
                               <BLOCK_ROOT>:<EPOCH_NUMBER> or a URL containing
                               the field ws_checkpoint with the same
                               information.

Logging
  -l, --logging=<LOG VERBOSITY LEVEL>
                             Logging verbosity levels: OFF, FATAL, ERROR, WARN,
                               INFO, DEBUG, TRACE, ALL (default: INFO).
      --log-color-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether Status and Event log messages include a
                               console color display code
                               Default: true
      --log-destination=<LOG_DESTINATION>
                             Whether a logger is added for the console, the log
                               file, or both (Valid values: BOTH, CONSOLE,
                               DEFAULT_BOTH, FILE, CUSTOM)
                               Default: DEFAULT_BOTH
      --log-file=<FILENAME>  Path containing the location (relative or
                               absolute) and the log filename. If not set will
                               default to <data-path>/logs/teku.log
      --log-file-name-pattern=<REGEX>
                             Pattern for the filename to apply to rolled over
                               log files. If not set will default to
                               <data-path>/logs/teku_%d{yyyy-MM-dd}.log
      --log-include-events-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether frequent update events are logged (e.g.
                               every slot and epoch event)
                               Default: true
      --log-include-validator-duties-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether events are logged when validators perform
                               duties
                               Default: true

Metrics
      --metrics-block-production-performance-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether block production timing metrics are
                               tracked and reported
                               Default: false
      --metrics-block-timing-tracking-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Whether block timing metrics are tracked and
                               reported
                               Default: true
      --metrics-categories[=<METRICS_CATEGORY>[,<METRICS_CATEGORY>...]...]
                             Metric categories to enable
                               Default: [JVM, PROCESS, NETWORK, BEACON,
                               STORAGE_FINALIZED_DB, STORAGE_HOT_DB, VALIDATOR,
                               STORAGE, VALIDATOR_PERFORMANCE, LIBP2P,
                               EXECUTOR, EVENTBUS, VALIDATOR_DUTY, DISCOVERY]
      --metrics-enabled[=<BOOLEAN>]
                             Enables metrics collection via Prometheus
                               Default: false
      --metrics-host-allowlist[=<hostname>[,<hostname>...]...]
                             Comma-separated list of hostnames to allow, or *
                               to allow any host
                               Default: [127.0.0.1, localhost]
      --metrics-interface=<NETWORK>
                             Metrics network interface to expose metrics for
                               Prometheus
                               Default: 127.0.0.1
      --metrics-port=<INTEGER>
                             Metrics port to expose metrics for Prometheus
                               Default: 8008
      --metrics-publish-endpoint=<URL>
                             Publish metrics for node monitoring to an external
                               service
      --metrics-publish-interval=<INTEGER>
                             Interval between metric publications to the
                               external service (measured in seconds)
                               Default: 60
Commands:
  help                  Display help information about the specified command.
  admin                 Holds advanced tools for node admins
  transition            Manually run state transitions
  peer                  Commands for LibP2P PeerID
  genesis               Commands for generating genesis state
  slashing-protection   Manage local slashing protection data used by the
                          validator client.
  migrate-database      Migrate the database to a specified version.
  debug-tools           Utilities for debugging issues
  voluntary-exit        Create and sign a voluntary exit for a specified
                          validator.
  validator-client, vc  Run a Validator Client that connects to a remote Beacon
                          Node
  bootnode              Run Teku in Bootnode mode
